p: The 20 study species (7 annuals and 13 perennials) included 18 forbs, one grass, and one shrub species (Table 1). There was a large difference (135‐fold) in 1,000‐seed mass between species (0.047 ± 0.002 g for Artemisia scoparia and 6.384 ± 0.101 g for Lagochilus ilicifolium). Seed length varied (8.9‐fold) from 0.86 ± 0.016 mm for Artemisia annua to 7.69 ± 0.178 mm for Stipa breviflora, and seed width (5.4‐fold) from 0.53 ± 0.034 mm for Artemisia scoparia to 2.86 ± 0.048 mm for Lagochilus ilicifolium.
